usecase.friends.relationship

Interface RelationNetwork

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BiDiRelationNetwork

    public interface RelationNetwork
extends java.io.Serializable
    RelationshipManagement manages the relationship between two UUID (which can represent any two objects) usually between people and people, but it's not the limitation of this interface, it really just defines the connection between any two UUID.

    Class Invariant:

    • getLayersOfConnection(p, k) always returns a integer between 0 and Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyConnectionOffset(java.util.UUID p, java.util.UUID k, int offset)
      Apply a offset in the layers of connection, without violating the class invariant.
      void connect(java.util.UUID p, java.util.UUID k)
      Add one layer of connection between p1 and p2.
      void disconnect(java.util.UUID p, java.util.UUID k)
      Remove one layer of connection between p1 and p2.
      java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getConnectedTo(java.util.UUID p)
      Get a list of P that is connected to p.
      boolean isConnected(java.util.UUID p, java.util.UUID k)
      Check if p1 and p2 are connected.
      void update(java.util.UUID p, java.util.Collection<java.util.UUID> ps, java.util.function.Function<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> function)
      Update the network by calling the function on every people that is specified by ps, returns an integer as offset and is applied to the network using applyConnectionOffset(UUID, UUID, int).
      void update(java.util.UUID p, java.util.function.Function<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> function)
      Update the network by calling the function on every people that is connected to p, the function returns an integer as offset and is applied to the network using applyConnectionOffset(UUID, UUID, int).

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(java.util.UUID p,
             java.util.UUID k)
        Add one layer of connection between p1 and p2.

        Note : if connect(p1, p2) is called twice, then getLayerOfConnection(p1, p2) should returns at least 2.

        Parameters:
        p - an UUID.
        k - an UUID.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(java.util.UUID p,
                java.util.UUID k)
        Remove one layer of connection between p1 and p2.

        Notice that the layers of connection is non-negative.

        Parameters:
        p - an UUID.
        k - an UUID.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected(java.util.UUID p,
                    java.util.UUID k)
        Check if p1 and p2 are connected.
        Parameters:
        p - an UUID.
        k - an UUID.
        Returns:
        true iff p1 and p2 are connected.

      • applyConnectionOffset

        void applyConnectionOffset(java.util.UUID p,
                           java.util.UUID k,
                           int offset)
        Apply a offset in the layers of connection, without violating the class invariant. i.e. if the offset would make the layers of connection becomes negative or over Integer.MAX_VALUE, it will be adjusted to the nearest bound.
        Parameters:
        p - an UUID
        k - an UUID
        offset - an integer describes the offset.

      • getConnectedTo

        java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getConnectedTo(java.util.UUID p)
        Get a list of P that is connected to p.
        Parameters:
        p - the p to check with.
        Returns:
        a list of P that is connected to p.

      • update

        void update(java.util.UUID p,
            java.util.function.Function<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> function)
        Update the network by calling the function on every people that is connected to p, the function returns an integer as offset and is applied to the network using applyConnectionOffset(UUID, UUID, int).
        Parameters:
        p - the p to check with.
        function - the function describes the change.

      • update

        void update(java.util.UUID p,
            java.util.Collection<java.util.UUID> ps,
            java.util.function.Function<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> function)
        Update the network by calling the function on every people that is specified by ps, returns an integer as offset and is applied to the network using applyConnectionOffset(UUID, UUID, int).
        Parameters:
        p - the p to check with.
        ps - the people to apply the function with (the domain of the function)
        function - the function describes the change.
